page.title: 07Historical Sites at Weston
page.content: Akeman Street is part of a Roman Road whch runs from from east to west across this block. There is a tumulus to the west of the A43 road which is thought to be a Roman burial mound. The Peat Pits were a source of agricul- tural peat and maul and Stone Pit Hills supplied stone for many 18th. and 19th. century houses in Weston. Two fields to the east of the A43 are called Badgers Drift and Strangers Drift and may have been cattle enclosures for travelling droves. Weston Manor played a significant part in the Civil War.
